definition: lit. knees pressed close/intimate/seated side by side/in close contact
to sit side-by-side and have a heart-to-heart talk (idiom)

sentences.english: ShangMingYang father came to visit troops, both father and son a heart-to-heart talk.
sentences.chinese: 汤名扬的爸爸来到部队探望儿子，父子二人促膝谈心。

sentences.english: Sloan: Last I heard you were at hand holding foot rubs and lots of late-night gab sessions.
sentences.chinese: 最新的消息是，你和她手牵手和多次促膝夜谈。

sentences.english: A long conversation with a friend.
sentences.chinese: 和好友的一次促膝长谈。

sentences.english: I spent 4 hours chatting with my grandmother in-law last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚，我和丈夫的祖母促膝长谈了4个小时。

sentences.english: Time alone with a good book.
sentences.chinese: 和好友的一次促膝长谈。

sentences.english: I got knee to knee with him.
I went down to meet him at the end of last season and had a long chat with him.
sentences.chinese: 上赛季末我去探望过他，并跟他促膝长谈过。

sentences.english: Now that everyone else has gone, both of us can have a heart-to-heart talk.
sentences.chinese: 既然别人都走了，我们俩人可以促膝谈心。

sentences.english: As a good long talk with a few old friends.
sentences.chinese: 比和几个老朋友促膝长谈更加有效。

sentences.english: On New Year's Eve, my father and my uncle talked about their work together.
sentences.chinese: 除夕那天，我的爸爸和叔叔促膝长谈他们的工作。

sentences.english: You've had these really deep conversations.
sentences.chinese: 你们俩促膝长谈，深入交流。

sentences.english: This was the place for our tete-a-tete.
sentences.chinese: 这图书馆是我们促膝谈心的地方。

sentences.english: I'll get knee to knee with her.
sentences.chinese: 我要好好地和她促膝长谈。

definition: to sit side-by-side and have a heart-to-heart talk (idiom)
to talk endlessly/talking of anything under the sun
lit. to live and sleep together (idiom); fig. a close friendship
variant of 炳燭|炳烛[bing3 zhu2]
to talk freely/to discuss without inhibition
to have a discussion in a group/to have a chat with sb
to talk of the past and discuss the present (idiom)/to chat freely/to discuss everything
